discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Audits, assessments, and independent verification of compliance certifications with agreement terms

When forming supply chain agreements between cloud service providers (CSPs) and cloud customers, it is essential to include provisions that allow for audits, assessments, and independent verification of compliance certifications. These elements ensure that the CSP is meeting the agreed-upon standards and regulatory requirements, providing the cloud customer with assurance regarding the security and compliance of their data and services. This clause is fundamental to maintaining transparency, accountability, and trust in the cloud service relationship. While organizational charts, customer policies, and regulatory guidelines are relevant, the ability to independently verify compliance is critical for ensuring adherence to the terms of the agreement.

choices.D: Regulatory guidelines impacting the cloud customer
choices.B: Policies and procedures of the cloud customer
choices.C: Audits, assessments and independent verification of compliance certifications with agreement terms

questions.question_text: Supply chain agreements between CSP and cloud customers should, at minimum, include:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The most appropriate contract term to meet a company's requirement for moving data from one cloud service provider (CSP) to another is:

D. Transition and data portability

Transition and data portability are essential terms that ensure a company can seamlessly transfer its data and applications from one CSP to another. These terms typically cover the processes and technologies needed to export data in a usable format, ensuring interoperability between different cloud environments. This is crucial for avoiding vendor lock-in and maintaining operational continuity during the transition.

Terms Specific to the Cloud
Transition and data portability-Is there such a clause, does it provide the customer with sufficient time and assistance to move its data to another CSP?

questions.question_text: Which of the following contract terms is necessary to meet a companyâ€™s requirement that needs to move data from one CSP to another?
Which of the following is a cloud-native solution designed to counter threats that do not exist within the enterprise?

discussion.content: Attribute-based access control (ABAC) provide least-privilege methods to counter threads that do not exist within the enterprise. I think that the right choice is "B".

comments.content: Agreed. Refer to page 150 of CCAK study guide.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Service-specific accounts and ABAC provide least-privilege methods to counter threats that do not exist within the enterprise (pg. 150 CCAK Study guide)

Selected Answer: B
CCAK Study Guide Pg 150: main motivators of CSPs include automation, speed and, to some extent, portability. Service-specific
accounts (i.e., object storage, cryptography and compute) and attribute-based access control (ABAC) provide leastprivilege
methods to counter threats that do not exist within the enterprise.

Selected Answer: A
The Cloud Octagon Model was developed to support organizations with:

A. risk assessment methodology.

The Cloud Octagon Model is designed to provide a comprehensive framework for assessing risks in cloud computing environments. It helps organizations identify and evaluate potential risks associated with cloud adoption and operation, thereby supporting informed decision-making regarding cloud security and compliance. By focusing on risk assessment, the model facilitates a structured approach to understanding and mitigating risks in cloud services.

questions.question_text: The Cloud Octagon Model was developed to support organizations:

choices.B: Role-based access controls in the production and development pipelines.
choices.C: Separation of production and development pipelines.
choices.A: Ensuring segregation of duties in the production and development pipelines.
choices.D: Periodic review of the Cl/CD pipeline audit logs to identify any access violations.

discussion.content: Best practice is to separate the pipeline that does the production pushes from the development pipeline. This reduces the number of people who can touch that production environment through the pipeline, and it isolates developers from directly modifying production.

Best practice is to separate the pipeline that does the production pushes from the development pipeline. This reduces the number of people who can touch that production environment through the pipeline, and it isolates developers from directly modifying production.

C - page 358 - Best practice is to separate the pipeline that does the production pushes from the development pipeline. This reduces the number of people who can touch that production environment through the pipeline, and it isolates developers from directly modifying production.

Correct Answer B
RBAC is a mechanism that restricts system access based on predefined roles, making it an effective method for controlling and limiting access to the pipeline production environment. While separating production and development pipelines is a good practice for maintaining a controlled and secure environment, it does not directly address the restriction of individuals' access.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST ensures adequate restriction on the number of people who can access the pipeline production environment?
